channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China stocks poised to reopen Tuesday with markets fixated on fiscal stimulus
item.description: Traders are closely watching for additional policy measures as Beijing has signaled a sense of urgency in bringing its economy back on track.

item.title: Tensions rise between banks and tech companies over online fraud liability in the UK
item.description: In the U.K., a number of financial firms see themselves as bearing the brunt of the cost for scams taking place virtually.

item.title: This 42-year-old built a $2 billion a year super app called Grab: I worked '20 hour' days
item.description: Anthony Tan, 42, is the co-founder and CEO of Grab. As of 2023, the company serves 35 million customers and provides 13 million gig jobs across Southeast Asia.

item.title: Mining giant Rio Tinto in talks to buy U.S. lithium producer Arcadium
item.description: No financial specifics were disclosed.

item.title: From guns to politics: See which factors are deterring Southeast Asians from visiting the U.S.
item.description: A survey from CNBC Travel shows how politics, the prevalence of guns and the fear of physical violence affect interest among Southeast Asians to visit the U.S.

item.title: Activist Starboard Value has $1 billion Pfizer stake, taps former executives for help, sources say
item.description: Starboard's stake comes amid a time of struggle at the drugmaker, which has begun to cut costs aggressively as demand for its Covid-19 medicines recedes.

item.title: Young Chinese are 'retiring' in the countryside as China's unemployment woes grate
item.description: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.

item.title: Fed close to pulling off the elusive economic soft landing in 2024 after great September jobs report
item.description: If this sounds like a Goldilocks scenario, it's probably not far from it, even with the lingering inflation concerns.

item.title: China-linked security breach targeted U.S. wiretap systems, WSJ reports
item.description: U.S. broadband providers had networks breached in a cyberattack tied to the Chinese government that targeted wiretap requests, The Wall Street Journal reports.

item.title: 'Joker: Folie a Deux' snares $40 million in domestic debut, less than half of first film
item.description: "Joker: Folie a Deux" stumbled to just $40 million in domestic ticket sales during it opening weekend.

item.title: Hollywood's franchise frenzy: More than half of top studios' 2025 movies are existing IP
item.description: The 2024 box office has been inundated with sequels, prequels and remakes. That trend will continue, and expand, in 2025.

item.title: Trump holds Pennsylvania rally at same venue of first assassination attempt, joined by Musk, Vance
item.description: Elon Musk spoke at Donald Trump's second Butler rally, marking the latest sign of support in their growing alliance.

item.title: Goldman Sachs says crude could spike by $20 on Iran oil shock
item.description: Oil prices could shoot up $20 per barrel if Iranian production sees a hit, said Goldman Sachs.Â

item.title: Japan PM Shigeru Ishiba asks ministers to craft economic relief package to cushion inflation impact
item.description: During his campaign, Ishiba vowed to reduce the burden on households suffering from rising living costs and showed intentions to boost rural revitalization.

item.title: China's stimulus rally has already sent stocks up 25%. And there could be more to come
item.description: Mainland markets is closed for a week-long holiday commemorating the 75th anniversary of the People's Republic of China. Trading is set to resume on Oct. 8.Â

item.title: A private island for $1,000 per night â for those who are willing to get there
item.description: Pinang Island is a rustic eco-resort that opened two years ago in Indonesia. But traveling to the remote island often requires three flights and a boat ride.

item.title: Harris floods the zone with Howard Stern, Stephen Colbert, podcast interviews in final election sprint
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are battling for the airwaves in the final sprint to the Nov. 5 election.

item.title: Stellantis files federal lawsuit against UAW union over strike threats
item.description: Stellantis is suing the United Auto Workers, escalating a monthslong battle between the trans-Atlantic automaker and American union, CNBC has learned.

item.title: Biden discourages Israel from striking Iran's oil industry, crude posts best week in more than year
item.description: Though oil prices have surged this week on geopolitical tensions, they have risen from a low baseline.

item.title: Jamie Dimon denies Trump's claim that JPMorgan CEO has endorsed him
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon previously urged corporate leaders to back Nikki Haley over Donald Trump. Trump faces Vice President Kamala Harris in November.

item.title: Ubisoft shares skyrocket 33% after report Tencent, Guillemot family considering buyout
item.description: Ubisoft shares surged 33% Friday after a media report that Tencent and the firm's founding Guillemot family are considering a potential buyout of the company.

item.title: Mortgage rates spike after stronger-than-expected jobs report
item.description: The average rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage is now 6.53% according to Mortgage News Daily.

item.title: Jim Cramer's week ahead: CPI data and earnings from Delta, Domino's and major banks
item.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer reviewed next week's top market-moving action.

item.title: Buttigieg claps back at Elon Musk for false claims about Helene federal response
item.description: Buttigieg replied to a post from Musk that falsely claimed the FAA was closing airspace in the Hurricane Helene disaster zone.

item.title: Venture capitalist Ben Horowitz says he plans to donate to VP Kamala Harris' campaign
item.description: In an email to Andreessen-Horowitz employees, co-founder Ben Horowitz said he planned to donate to Kamala Harris' campaign for president.

item.title: Rivian shares fall after EV maker slashes production forecast, misses Q3 delivery expectations
item.description: Rivian produced 13,157 vehicles at its manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois, and delivered 10,018 vehicles during the same period.

item.title: As Apple enters AI race, iPhone maker turns to its army of developers for an edge
item.description: As Apple prepares Apple Intelligence to jump into tech's AI race, it's relying on one of its strongest advantages: Its army of 34 million app developers.

item.title: European Union votes to impose tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles
item.description: European Union member states on Friday voted in favor of the European Commission's proposal to impose definitive tariffs on battery electric vehicles from China.

item.title: Maersk slumps 5% as the end of U.S. port strikes weighs on European shipping stocks
item.description: Shares of Moller-Maersk slumped more than 8% Friday as European shipping companies fell on the conclusion of a U.S. port strike.

item.title: Satellite imagery shows Iranian oil tankers at countryâs major terminal disappearing amid fears of Israeli counterattack
item.description: Fifteen miles off Iran's northwestern coast, the Kharg Island terminal handles more than 90% of the country's crude exports.
